yarpc 0.3.0a Documentation

API Documentation

API Documentation¶

Submodules¶

yarpc.client module¶

class yarpc.client.Client(channel_name: str, loads: Union[Callable[[bytes], Any], Callable[[str], Any], None] = None, dumps: Union[Callable[[Any], bytes], Callable[[Any], str], None] = None, loop: Optional[asyncio.events.AbstractEventLoop] = None, default_timeout: Optional[int] = None, default_expect_responses: Optional[int] = None)¶

Bases: yarpc.abc.ABCClient

RPC client sends commands to servers and listens for responses.

call(command_index: int, data: Dict[str, Any] = {}, timeout: Optional[float] = None, expect_responses: Optional[int] = None) → yarpc.abc.ResponsesIterator¶

Calls command and returns received responses. Skips response processing completely if timeout is None.

close() → None¶

Closes connections stopping client.

run(*args, **kwargs) → None¶

A blocking way to start client. Takes same arguments as Server.start.

coroutine start(redis_address: Union[Tuple[str, int], str], **kwargs) → None¶

Starts client.

class yarpc.client.EmptyResponses¶

Bases: yarpc.abc.ResponsesIterator

Looks and behaves the same way as ResponsesWithTimeout, but is empty.

class yarpc.client.ResponsesWithTimeout(client: Client, queue: asyncio.Queue[Response], address: str, timeout: float, expect_responses: Optional[int] = None)¶

Bases: yarpc.abc.ResponsesIterator

Provides access to command responses for limited time.

responses_seen¶
time_remaining¶

yarpc.server module¶

class yarpc.server.Server(channel_name: str, loads: Union[Callable[[bytes], Any], Callable[[str], Any], None] = None, dumps: Union[Callable[[Any], bytes], Callable[[Any], str], None] = None, loop: Optional[asyncio.events.AbstractEventLoop] = None, node: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: yarpc.abc.ABCServer

RPC server listens for commands from clients and sends responses.

close() → None¶

Closes connections stopping server.

command(index: int) → Callable[[Any], None]¶
node¶
register_command(index: int, fn: Any) → int¶
remove_command(index: int) → Any¶
coroutine reply(*, address: Optional[str], status: yarpc.enums.StatusCode, data: Any) → None¶
run(*args, **kwargs) → None¶

A blocking way to start server. Takes same arguments as Client.start.

coroutine start(redis_address: Union[Tuple[str, int], str], **kwargs) → None¶

Starts command processing.

yarpc.abc module¶

class yarpc.abc.ResponsesIterator¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Provides access to command responses.

Instances can be awaited to get all responses at once or used as async iterator to process responses as soon as they come.

class yarpc.abc.ABCClient¶

Bases: yarpc.abc.RPCTransport
